title: Academic Thesis Defense Visual Aid Designer
description: A single-page tool to help graduate students prepare effective thesis defense slide decks by generating structured slide outlines and visual hierarchy recommendations from uploaded thesis text and draft slide content. Supports file uploads and text input with actionable, safe, and privacy-conscious guidance.
inputLabel: Upload thesis documents (PDF, DOCX, images, data snippets) and/or enter draft slide text or bullet points
outputLabel: Structured slide deck outline and visual hierarchy suggestions
systemPrompt: You are an expert assistant specialized in helping graduate students design effective visual aids for thesis oral defense presentations. Given uploaded thesis documents and draft slide text or bullet points, generate a structured slide deck outline aligned with the defense narrative, including clear visual hierarchy and layout recommendations. Do NOT rewrite or evaluate thesis content. Provide actionable, non-evaluative advice on integrating figures, tables, and data visuals, and balancing text and visuals for clarity and engagement. Enforce safety: reject unsupported file types or malformed input, refuse requests without proper input, and never expose or store data insecurely. Respond only in plain text unless structured-output is enabled, in which case produce valid JSON conforming to the outline and recommendations schema. Disclaim that this tool is an aid and not a substitute for advisor or committee guidance. Maintain user privacy and confidentiality at all times.

presets.label: Outline Focus
presets.prompt: Generate a clear and concise structured slide deck outline from the uploaded thesis documents and draft slide text, emphasizing logical narrative flow and key defense points.
presets.hint: Focus on the arrangement and prioritization of slide content.

presets.label: Visual Hierarchy Focus
presets.prompt: Provide detailed visual hierarchy recommendations including emphasis, layout suggestions, and guidance for integrating figures and tables effectively in the slide deck.
presets.hint: Focus on slide visual design and data integration.

presets.label: Balanced Advice
presets.prompt: Generate a combined response with a structured slide outline and visual hierarchy recommendations, including advice on balancing text and visuals for clarity and engagement.
presets.hint: Comprehensive guidance for slide deck preparation.

jsonSchemaHint: Output JSON should include keys: 'slideOutline' (an array of slide objects with titles and content summaries) and 'visualHierarchyRecommendations' (an array of suggestions per slide).
clarifyPrompt: Please upload your thesis documents (PDF, DOCX, PNG, JPG, CSV, JSON snippets) and/or enter your draft slide text or bullet points in valid JSON format. Ensure files are within size limits and formats supported. What would you like assistance with today: outline generation, visual hierarchy advice, or both?
finalizePrompt: Based on your inputs, I will generate a structured slide deck outline aligned with your thesis defense narrative, along with visual hierarchy and data integration recommendations. Confirm to proceed or specify refinements.

idea.workingTitle: Academic Thesis Defense Visual Aid Designer

niche.scenario: Preparing visual aids for thesis oral defense presentations

idea.problem: Graduate students often struggle to create effective, visually coherent, and persuasive slide decks for their thesis oral defense due to lack of structured guidance on slide content prioritization, visual hierarchy, and integration of complex data and arguments. Existing tools focus on abstract simplification or slide text optimization but do not assist specifically in designing comprehensive visual aids that align with defense goals and narrative flow.
inputs: Uploaded thesis chapters or thesis summary documents
Draft slide text or bullet points
Research data snippets and figure/image files
Defense committee guidelines or evaluation criteria (optional)
outputs: Structured slide deck outline aligned with defense narrative
Visual hierarchy recommendations for slides (e.g., emphasis, layout suggestions)
Suggestions for integrating figures, tables, and data visuals effectively
Advice on balancing text and visuals for clarity and engagement
Customizable slide templates tailored for thesis defense styles
whyItWins: Targets the specific and high-stakes scenario of thesis oral defense preparation where visual aids critically impact presentation success
Goes beyond text optimization by integrating visual design principles and data visualization guidance in one system
Supports iterative refinement with actionable, structured feedback rather than generic style tips
Facilitates repeated use as students prepare multiple defense presentations or revisions
Lays foundation for a multi-page system that can manage slide assets, rehearsal notes, and committee feedback integration

upgradePath.today: Lightweight tool generating slide deck outline and visual hierarchy suggestions from uploaded thesis text and draft slide content
upgradePath.in90Days: Add interactive visual template editor with drag-and-drop functionality, figure/table integration assistant, and basic rehearsal timing planner
upgradePath.in12Months: Develop a full multi-page app incorporating slide asset management, committee feedback tracking, rehearsal video upload and annotation, peer review collaboration, and export to popular presentation software formats

riskNotes: Must avoid direct content rewriting that might breach academic integrity or originality
Should not provide any evaluative feedback on thesis content correctness or scientific validity
Needs to clearly disclaim that it is an aid tool, not a substitute for advisor or committee guidance
Ensure privacy and security of potentially unpublished thesis materials and data

blueprint.summary: A specialized multi-page application to assist graduate students in designing effective, visually coherent thesis defense slide decks by providing structured outlines, visual hierarchy recommendations, data integration advice, and customizable templates, evolving from a lightweight outline generator to a comprehensive defense preparation platform.
blueprint.primaryUser: Graduate Student preparing thesis oral defense presentations
successMetrics: User adoption rate among graduate students preparing thesis defenses
User satisfaction with slide deck quality and visual coherence
Frequency of iterative slide deck refinements using the tool
Reduction in user-reported stress or difficulty in slide preparation
Engagement with advanced features like template editor and rehearsal planner

components.name: User Interface Pages
components.responsibility: Provide interactive pages for uploading thesis content, drafting slide text, viewing structured slide outlines, receiving visual hierarchy recommendations, editing slide templates, managing rehearsal plans, and tracking committee feedback.
notes: Pages must handle file uploads securely with size and format validations.
UI should clearly disclaim tool limitations per risk notes.
Support iterative workflows with autosave and versioning hints.

components.name: Core API Layer
components.responsibility: Expose endpoints for content ingestion, slide outline generation, visual hierarchy and data integration suggestions, template management, rehearsal planning, and committee feedback handling.
notes: Must enforce authentication and authorization for user data privacy.
Validate inputs to prevent malicious uploads or data corruption.
Implement rate limiting to prevent abuse.

components.name: Persistent Data Storage
components.responsibility: Store user accounts, uploaded thesis documents, draft slide content, generated slide outlines, visual hierarchy recommendations, slide templates, rehearsal plans, and committee feedback securely and with version control.
notes: Ensure encryption at rest and in transit for sensitive thesis materials.
Support indexing for efficient retrieval of slide assets and feedback.

components.name: Natural Language Processing Service
components.responsibility: Analyze uploaded thesis text and draft slide content to extract key points, structure narrative flow, and generate slide deck outlines aligned with defense goals.
notes: Must avoid rewriting or altering original content to preserve academic integrity.
Provide confidence scores and highlight uncertainties in analysis.
Handle diverse academic writing styles and disciplines.

components.name: Visual Hierarchy and Data Integration Service
components.responsibility: Analyze slide content and uploaded figures/tables to recommend visual hierarchy, layout suggestions, and effective integration of data visuals for clarity and engagement.
notes: Support common figure and table formats with metadata extraction.
Include fallback recommendations when data visuals are missing or insufficient.

components.name: Background Processing Jobs
components.responsibility: Handle asynchronous tasks such as processing uploaded documents, generating slide outlines and visual suggestions, sending notification emails, and backing up user data.
notes: Implement retry and failure handling with alerting.
Ensure jobs are idempotent to avoid duplicate processing.
Prioritize jobs based on user activity and resource availability.

edgeCases: User uploads unsupported or corrupted file formats.
NLP or visual analysis services fail or return low-confidence results.
User attempts to generate slide outline without sufficient input data.
Concurrent edits to slide drafts or templates causing conflicts.
Large thesis documents causing processing timeouts or resource exhaustion.
User loses internet connection during upload or editing sessions.
Unauthorized access attempts to user data or API endpoints.
User deletes uploaded documents referenced in slide outlines.
nonGoals: Providing evaluative or scientific feedback on thesis content correctness.
Automatically rewriting or generating thesis content to preserve academic integrity.
Replacing advisor or committee guidance on thesis defense preparation.
Supporting general-purpose slide design unrelated to thesis defense.
Hosting or streaming rehearsal videos in initial versions.
Integrating with external presentation software beyond export formats.

dataFlow: User authenticates and accesses UI pages requiring authentication.
On /upload page, user uploads thesis documents (PDF, DOCX, images, data snippets) with client-side validation; files and metadata sent to /api/upload-document endpoint.
API validates file type, size, and user authorization; stores document in data-storage with encryption; triggers DocumentProcessingJob asynchronously.
DocumentProcessingJob extracts text and metadata, stores processed content for NLP analysis.
User drafts slide content on /slide-drafts page; inputs saved via /api/save-slide-draft endpoint with autosave and versioning hints.
User requests slide outline generation on /slide-outline page by selecting thesis documents and slide drafts; request sent to /api/generate-slide-outline endpoint.
API validates inputs and user authorization; triggers SlideOutlineGenerationJob asynchronously.
SlideOutlineGenerationJob calls NLP service to analyze thesis text and slide drafts, generating structured slide outlines with confidence scores.
SlideOutlineGenerationJob calls Visual Analysis service to generate visual hierarchy and data integration recommendations.
Results stored in data-storage as SlideOutline and VisualHierarchyRecommendation linked to user.
User retrieves generated outline and recommendations via /api/get-slide-outline endpoint for display on /slide-outline page.
User customizes slide templates on /template-editor page; changes saved via /api/save-slide-template endpoint with autosave and conflict detection.
User plans rehearsal timings and notes on /rehearsal-planner page; data saved via /api/save-rehearsal-plan endpoint.
User uploads or enters committee feedback on /committee-feedback page; data saved via /api/save-committee-feedback endpoint.
NotificationJob sends emails or in-app notifications on job completions or important events.
DataBackupJob runs periodically to backup user data and uploaded content securely.
validationRules: File uploads must be limited to allowed formats: PDF, DOCX, PNG, JPG, CSV, JSON snippets; reject unsupported or corrupted files.
Maximum file size limits enforced per upload (e.g., 20MB for documents, 5MB for images).
All API requests must include valid authenticated userId matching session.
Slide draft content must be valid JSON structure representing text or bullet points; reject malformed JSON.
Slide outline generation requires at least one thesisDocumentId and a valid slideDraftId; reject requests missing inputs.
Template data must conform to defined JSON schema for slide components; reject invalid or incomplete templates.
Rehearsal plan data must include timing and notes in JSON format; validate timing values are positive and notes are strings.
Committee feedback data must be valid JSON with required fields; reject empty or malformed feedback.
Autosave operations must validate partial inputs and maintain version consistency.
Rate limiting applied per user to API endpoints to prevent abuse (e.g., max 10 uploads per hour).
errorHandling: Return standardized error response with { success: false, error: string } for all API failures.
For file uploads, detect unsupported formats or corrupted files and return descriptive error messages.
On NLP or visual analysis service failures, return partial success with warnings and log errors for retry.
If slide outline generation requested without sufficient data, return 400 Bad Request with explanation.
Handle concurrent edits by implementing optimistic concurrency control; reject conflicting updates with informative errors.
For large documents causing timeouts, return 503 Service Unavailable with retry instructions.
Detect lost internet connection during uploads or edits via client-side timeout and retry mechanisms.
Unauthorized access attempts return 401 Unauthorized or 403 Forbidden with no sensitive data exposure.
If user deletes documents referenced in slide outlines, mark outlines as stale and notify user to regenerate.
Background jobs implement retry logic with exponential backoff and alerting on repeated failures.
securityNotes: Enforce authentication and authorization on all API routes; verify user owns or has access to requested resources.
Encrypt all sensitive data at rest using database encryption features and in transit via HTTPS/TLS.
Sanitize all inputs to prevent injection attacks, including file metadata and JSON content.
Implement CSRF protection on state-changing API endpoints.
Use secure cookies or tokens for session management with appropriate expiration and renewal.
Limit file upload types and scan for malware or malicious content.
Implement rate limiting and IP throttling to mitigate abuse and denial-of-service attacks.
Log security-relevant events and monitor for suspicious activity.
Ensure background jobs do not expose sensitive data in logs or error messages.
Regularly update dependencies and patch known vulnerabilities.

acceptanceTests.given: An authenticated graduate student on the /upload page
acceptanceTests.when: They upload a valid PDF thesis document under size limit
acceptanceTests.then: The document is accepted, stored securely, and upload status with document ID is returned

acceptanceTests.given: A user attempts to upload an unsupported file format
acceptanceTests.then: The API rejects the upload with an error indicating unsupported format

acceptanceTests.given: A user edits slide drafts on /slide-drafts page
acceptanceTests.when: They save draft content with valid JSON structure
acceptanceTests.then: The draft is saved with a draft ID and autosave versioning hints are updated

acceptanceTests.given: A user requests slide outline generation with valid thesis document IDs and slide draft ID
acceptanceTests.then: The system triggers asynchronous job and returns success with outline and recommendations IDs

acceptanceTests.given: The background job completes slide outline generation
acceptanceTests.then: The API returns the structured outline data and visual hierarchy recommendations

acceptanceTests.given: A user edits slide templates on /template-editor
acceptanceTests.then: The template is saved with a template ID and conflicts are detected and resolved

acceptanceTests.given: A user plans rehearsal timings with valid timing and notes
acceptanceTests.then: The plan is saved and a plan ID is returned

acceptanceTests.given: A user uploads committee feedback data
acceptanceTests.then: The feedback is stored and a feedback ID is returned

acceptanceTests.given: An unauthenticated user attempts to access /slide-drafts page
acceptanceTests.then: They are redirected to login page

acceptanceTests.given: A user deletes a thesis document referenced in a slide outline
acceptanceTests.when: They attempt to view the outline
acceptanceTests.then: The system marks the outline as stale and prompts user to regenerate
